How well has Trump handled the economy? It’s complicatedTrump ran mostly on his record rather than future plans, and the country’s financial well-being was at the top of his “Promises Kept” list.
Trump, Biden project confidence as Election Day winds down

Surging coronavirus cases loom large in pivotal WisconsinIt is a crisis unfolding before voters’ eyes, shaping their lives as many of them prepare to cast ballots on Tuesday — and one that Democrats believe will render Trump’s relentlessly sunny prognosis about the course of the virus untenable in a state he narrowly won in 2016.
Photos: Election Day around the countryVoters across the United States were lining up, donning masks, and casting ballots in the presidential election and in statewide and local races.

Massachusetts could set new record for voter turnout, Galvin saysMassachusetts voters are turning out in record numbers Tuesday and Secretary of State William Galvin said Election Day 2020 has so far not been marred by any major snafus, mechanical or manmade.

Mass. voters pack lines at polls on Election Day 2020 Voters hit the polls Tuesday with high enthusiasm, packing lines at some polling stations in Mass. an hour before they opened, reflecting the historic presidential campaign that has played out during a pandemic and concerns that the outcome could lead to violence.

Role reversal: Despite the polls, Democrats are anxious and Trump’s supporters confidentThere is a strange reversal afoot. Democrats, still scarred by Hillary Clinton’s upset loss to President Trump in 2016, are wracked with anxiety, and it is Trump and his base who are reveling in a victory they swear they can taste.

Undeterred by pandemic, Americans prepare to render verdict on TrumpVoters on both sides of the nation’s widening political divide prepared Monday to render a verdict on President Donald Trump’s four tumultuous years in the White House and, in particular, his management of the coronavirus pandemic that has upended American life for the past eight months.

The world needs Covid-19 vaccines. It may also be overestimating their powerThe world might in the not-too-distant future get vaccines against Covid-19. But those vaccines won’t necessarily prevent all or even most infections.
